intro: Thelypteris praetervisa, commonly known as the common holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Thelypteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant produces spores on the underside of its fronds, which are arranged in clusters called sori. Thelypteris praetervisa is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and the Americas. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks.
